security: This document discusses disagreements regarding the release of specific documents related to the Kennedy assassination, including concerns about initial responses being dismissed as "same old stuff" and the need to revisit documents concerning Australian liaison and state cover. Revealing these internal disagreements could damage the CIA's reputation and undermine the perception of transparency in the release of JFK assassination records.
summary: J. Barry Harrelson sends a note to Eileen M. Wukitch regarding issues for a May meeting, including concerns about document releases, Australian liaison documents, and state cover documents.
summary_one_paragraph: On April 16, 1998, J. Barry Harrelson from OIM/HRP sent a secret note to Eileen M. Wukitch at DO, alerting her to issues for an upcoming May meeting with Gunn and staff. The topics included addressing concerns about the initial response to a memo regarding document releases, which was dismissed as "same old stuff," revisiting Australian liaison documents (assigned to Hal Bean), and resolving disagreements on state cover documents, for which Lee and the lawyers needed to receive documents by Friday for discussion on Monday.
title: Alert: May meeting issue
